page.title: 10HOUSING
page.content: Most of the houses around here are in very good condition.People generally spend quite a lot of time and trouble keeping their houses looking nice.There are some thatched houses but most of them now have slates on the roofs.There are only a few cob{ {(mud)}houses in this area.This is unusual for Devon.We think that this must be because of all the quarries which are nearby.In Westleigh and Burlescombe there are some new houses. In Westleigh thee is quite a large estate of houses.However in Holcombe Rogus,very little building is allowed because the water supply will not cope,so apart from a few houses and bungalows everything in Holcombe, Staple Cross and Hockworthy is all old.Tourists often are really surprised to find Holcombe Rogus.They think that it looks so quaint.
